node.title: Biden’s Democracy Conference Is About Much More Than Democracy
node.description: Democracies can find strength in numbers.

node.title: Fred Hiatt, Washington Post Editorial Page Editor, Dies at 66
node.description: He used his powerful platform to champion human rights, caution against a Trump presidency and condemn the killing of a Saudi columnist for the paper.

node.title: Trump’s Blood Oxygen Level in Covid Bout Was Dangerously Low, Former Aide Says
node.description: Mark Meadows, Mr. Trump’s former chief of staff, said in his new book that the weakened president’s blood oxygen level reached 86 during a harrowing fight against the coronavirus.

node.title: Right vs. Right vs. Left: Governor’s Race Puts Georgia at Center of 2022 Drama
node.description: Former Senator David Perdue, encouraged by Donald Trump, is challenging Gov. Brian Kemp, a fellow Republican who defied the former president.

node.title: Thinking of hosting a holiday party? Here are a few tips.
node.description: By Ronda Kaysen

node.title: Georgia Port Expedites Expansion to Decrease Bottleneck, a Key Contributor to Inflation
node.description: The new space for storing containers will be around 150 acres, Griffin Lynch said, with over a third of the land expected to be ready by January.

node.title: Inmate Confesses to Another Killing Before His Execution, Tells Cops Where to Find Body
node.description: David Neal Cox, the first man executed in Mississippi since 2012, confessed to a 2007 murder of his sister-in-law before his death for killing his wife.

node.title: Trial Begins for Woman Accused of Killing Husband to Avoid Divorce, Get Insurance Payout
node.description: Lynlee Renick is charged with first-degree murder in the 2017 killing of her husband, Ben Renick.

node.title: Multiple Groups File Lawsuit Against Idaho Law That Could Kill 90 Percent of State's Wolves
node.description: In addition to killing up to 90 percent of the state's wolves, the groups say the hunting law could also kill, harm federally protected lynx and grizzly bears.

node.title: How this Victorian queer community is finding beauty and identity through clothing swap
node.description: When we are getting ready in the morning, most of us rummage through the wardrobe trying to pick out what we're going to wear that day. But for some people, it's not that simple.

node.title: Is the holiday over? Airbnb slams 'incredibly damaging' rental policy plans
node.description: People who let out holiday homes in WA might have to join a statewide register and limit rental nights under draft rules that booking sites say are the strictest in the nation.

node.title: Tommy Fury pulls out of Jake Paul fight
node.description: Tommy Fury says he has been forced to withdraw from his upcoming fight with YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul due to a severe chest infection and a broken rib.

node.title: Financial regulators looking into Donald Trump's new social media venture
node.description: US financial regulators are examining the deal that would bring Donald Trump's new social media company to the stock market, one that has attracted both legions of fans of the former president and people looking to make a quick profit.

node.title: Energy company forecasts 'potential' for offshore wind farm capable of powering smelter
node.description: The Alcoa Aluminium Smelter in Portland is one of the Victoria's biggest electricity users. One of the companies that supplies its power wants to turn it green.

node.title: Fifth Ashes Test goes to tender as Cricket Australia looks for Perth replacement
node.description: Cricket Australia announces it will put the fifth Test out for tender after cancelling the Perth clash over COVID restrictions.

node.title: Christmas cash splash expected as Australians raid COVID-19 savings
node.description: Australians are expected to splash much of the cash they stashed during lockdowns on Christmas spending, after October and November sales already recorded big gains.

node.title: Black Ferns player says coaching comments contributed to mental breakdown
node.description: Black Ferns hooker Te Kura Ngata-Aerengamate says she had a breakdown on tour and disparaging comments from coaching staff led to anxiety and hyperventilation.

node.title: Union withdraws strike notices for KiwiRail workers
node.description: A union for KiwiRail workers has withdrawn strike notices after getting a new offer from management.

node.title: Third party to probe events before Michigan school shooting
node.description: "It's critically important to the victims, our staff and our entire community that a full and transparent accounting be made," the district superintendent said.

node.title: Democratic senators want student loan interest waived
node.description: The group of lawmakers also wants the Biden administration to give borrowers who defaulted a "fresh start" with automatic rehabilitation of their loans.

node.title: North Carolina Court Halts Candidate Filings for All State Legislature, U.S. House Races
node.description: The halt came from an order after it was requested in a civil trial, with plaintiffs alleging gerrymandering in favor of the GOP.

node.title: Death Penalty Off Table for Man Accused in Cop's Killing After He Asks to Waive Jury Trial
node.description: The prosecution agreed to drop the death penalty against Jason D. Brown after "conferring with Allan's family." The judge will hear the case in February.

node.title: Federal Pandemic Aid Will Provide Running Water to Some Poor Parts of Kentucky: Governor
node.description: The federal aid will provide some Kentucky residents with access to potable water service or running water for the first time, according to Governor Andy Beshear.

node.title: 'Kona Low' Wallops Hawaii With High Winds, Threat of 'Catastrophic Flooding'
node.description: "Now is the time to make sure you have an emergency plan in place and supplies ready should you need to move away from rising water," Governor David Ige said.

node.title: A-League Women's wrap: Wellington, Sydney and Victory shine
node.description: Can underdogs Wellington Phoenix shake up the A-League Women's established order? Will Sydney's front three continue firing? And just how much better can Melbourne Victory get? Samantha Lewis reviews round one.

node.title: New COVID-19 mandate rules millions of private workers must be vaccinated in New York City
node.description: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio imposes the United States's most-sweeping vaccine mandate, impacting around 3.7 million workers in the private sector.

node.title: New locally acquired COVID case in Queensland believed to be source of Gold Coast cluster
node.description: The man is believed to have been infectious in the community for a number of days and may have travelled in NSW.

node.title: NSW Omicron infections grow, source of 'mystery' cluster traced to Nigeria
node.description: Health authorities in NSW announce six new Omicron COVID-19 infections, taking the state's total number of cases to 31.

node.title: Government reveals 25-year plan to tackle family and sexual violence
node.description: Te Aorerekura represents an evolution in the journey to address violence in homes and in communities, says Minister for the Prevention of Family Violence Marama Davidson.

node.title: New York City to Mandate Vaccines for Employees at Private Businesses
node.description: The mandate, set to take effect just before Mayor Bill de Blasio leaves office, will apply to workers at about 184,000 businesses. It is likely to face legal challenges.
